title: Indoor Barbecue Pork Chops
ingredients: 8 (5- to 7-oz) bone-in pork rib chops, 1/2" thick, trimmed
directions: Combine 1 tbsp sugar, paprika, salt, pepper, and cayenne in a bowl.
Transfer 2 tbsp spice mixture to a second bowl and stir in the cornstarch. Reserve remaining spice mixture for the sauce.
Using kitchen shears, snip through the fat surrounding the loin muscle of each chop in two places, about 2" apart.
Pat the chops dry with paper towels and sprinkle all over with the cornstarch mixture.
Heat oil in a 12" nonstick skillet over medium-high heat until just smoking.
Add 4 chops to the skillet and cook until browned and meat registers 140 degrees, about 2 minutes per side.
Transfer the chops to a rimmed baking sheet and tent with aluminum foil. Repeat with the remaining four chops.
Add butter to the now empty skillet and melt over medium heat.
Add reserved spice mixture and cook until fragrant, about 30 seconds.
Carefully whisk in ketchup, vinegar, liquid smoke, and remaining 2 tbsp of sugar. Bring to a simmer and remove from heat.
Return the chops to the skilled one at a time. Turn to coat with sauce. And transfer to a platter.
Stir any accumulated juices from the sheat into the remaining sauce.
Serve the chops, passing remaining sauce separately.
